definitions.definition: A structure or annexe (especially one with a sloping roof) extending from the side of a building , sometimes as protection from the weather.
Something forming a shelter or canopy over something; an awning , shelter , etc.
Any of the sloping roofs at the side of a real tennis court .
An apartment or suite found on an upper floor, or floors, of a tall building, especially one that is expensive or luxurious with panoramic views.

main_definition: ( now historical ) A structure or annexe (especially one with a sloping roof) extending from the side of a building , sometimes as protection from the weather. [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , now rare ) Something forming a shelter or canopy over something; an awning , shelter , etc. [from 16th c.]
( tennis ) Any of the sloping roofs at the side of a real tennis court . [from 17th c.]
An apartment or suite found on an upper floor, or floors, of a tall building, especially one that is expensive or luxurious with panoramic views. [from 19th c.]
